'Perspective' in theory of cognition is the choice of a or a reference (or the
result of this choice) from which to sense, categorize, measure or codify
experience, cohesively forming a coherent belief, typically for comparing with
another. One may further recognize a number of subtly distinctive meanings,
close to those of paradigm, 'point of view', reality tunnel, umwelt, or
weltanschauung.

To choose a perspective is to choose a value system and, unavoidably, an
associated belief system. When we look at a business perspective, we are looking
at a monetary base values system and beliefs. When we look at a human
perspective, it is a more social value system and its associated beliefs.
